quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.
author: Unknown

quote: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Wisdom is doing now what you are going to be happy with later on.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: You cannot push anyone up a ladder unless he is willing to climb a little himself.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: You're never given a dream without also being given the power to make it true.
author: Richard Bach

quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

quote: Be grateful for what you have now, and nothing should be taken for granted.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
author: Epictetus

quote: The more you are grateful for what you have the more you will have to be grateful for.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.
author: Gary Keller

quote: When you are tempted to give up, your breakthrough is probably just around the corner.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
author: Epictetus

quote: A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The difference between treason and patriotism is only a matter of dates.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: It's easier to go down a hill than up it but the view is much better at the top.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
author: John Carmack

quote: So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: The first step is to establish that something is possible; then probability will occur.
author: Elon Musk

quote: The way we feel is the direct result of what we think.
author: Peter A. Cohen

quote: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

quote: Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.
author: Kamal Ravikant

quote: Remember, hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things.
author: Stephen King

quote: The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
author: George Washington

quote: Learn from the rejection and turn it into an opportunity!
author: Mary Engelbreit

quote: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
author: Herman Melville

quote: The only difference between success and failure is the ability to take action.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: A man is great not because he hasn't failed; a man is great because failure hasn't stopped him.
author: Confucius

quote: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Waste not fresh tears over old griefs.
author: Euripides

quote: The time is now, the place is here. Stay in the present.
author: Dan Millman

quote: Time heals what reason cannot.
author: Seneca

quote: Death smiles at us all. All we can do is smile back.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: You don't know who is important to you until you actually lose them.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If you throw away all thoughts of attainment, you will then come to see the real purpose of your quest.
author: Seungsahn

quote: The more knowledge you have, the more you're free to rely on your instincts.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it. A man will find that as he alters his thoughts toward things and other people, things and other people will alter towards him.
author: James Allen

quote: Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: The fastest way to change is to laugh at your own folly.
author: Spencer Johnson

quote: Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.
author: Robert Greene

quote: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: People think about what they don't want and attract more of the same.
author: Unknown

quote: The swift wind of compromise is a lot more devastating than the sudden jolt of misfortune.
author: Charles Swindoll

quote: Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Anyone who reads a book with a sense of obligation does not understand the art of reading.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: All great truths begin as blasphemies.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: To improve is to change, so to be perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: A person hears only what they understand.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him.
author: James Allen

quote: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: You make your own luck if you stay at it long enough.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: No matter how tall the mountain is, it cannot block the sun.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Do not try to be on the side of the majority, but live according to your inner laws.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Poetry is written with tears, fiction with blood, and history with invisible ink.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

quote: It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

quote: To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

quote: Only one thing is ever guaranteed, that is that you will definitely not achieve the goal if you don't take the shot.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quote: No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
author: Carl Bard

quote: Happiness is a choice, not a result. Nothing will make you happy until you choose to be happy.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.
author: Christopher Columbus

quote: It isn't that they can't see the solution. It is that they can't see the problem.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

quote: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: To share your weakness is to make yourself vulnerable; to make yourself vulnerable is to show your strength.
author: Criss Jami

quote: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: What gets measured gets improved.
author: Robin Sharma

quote: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Be brave enough to suck at something new.
author: Unknown

quote: Everyday is a second chance.
author: Unknown

quote: Man must use what he has, not hope for what is not.
author: G.I. Gurdjieff

quote: It ain't where you start in life, it's where you end up, and what you did along the way.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: I do not seek. I find.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Don´t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.
author: Christopher McCandless

quote: The real measure of your wealth is how much you'd be worth if you lost all your money.
author: Unknown

quote: If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.
author: Criss Jami

quote: Better late than never.
author: Spencer Johnson

quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
author: Jack London

quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: You may be one person in this world, but to one person you may mean the world.
author: Unknown

quote: Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: We turn not older with years but newer every day.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Believe and you're halfway there.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Nothing you do is going to matter that much in the long run. Don't take yourself so seriously.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: When you make a choice, you change the future.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quote: Always look on the bright side of things. If you can't comprehend this, polish that which has become dull until it begins to shine.
author: Zen Proverb

quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
author: Judy Garland

quote: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.
author: Aristotle

quote: Peace is not the absence of conflict, but the ability to cope with it.
author: Unknown

quote: Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

quote: Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Lost Time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: You will succeed because most people are lazy.
author: Shahir Zag

quote: Never say never, because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: A man is great not because he hasn't failed; a man is great because failure hasn't stopped him.
author: Confucius

quote: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Nothing important is learned; it is simply remembered.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: When you are tempted to give up, your breakthrough is probably just around the corner.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
author: Nikola Tesla

quote: Work joyfully and peacefully, knowing that right thoughts and right efforts inevitably bring about right results.
author: James Allen

quote: Walk slowly but never walk backward.
author: Unknown

quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
author: Robert Greene

quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.
author: Simon Sinek

quote: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: Before enlightenment; chop wood, carry water. After enlightenment; chop wood, carry water.
author: Buddha

quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Genius, in truth, means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.
author: William James

quote: All problems are illusions of the mind.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst thing you can do is nothing.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.
author: George Washington

quote: Lust, anger and greed are the three gates to self-destructive hell.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Success is not the result of making money; making money is the result of success - and success is in direct proportion to our service.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: There is a difference between giving directions and giving direction.
author: Simon Sinek

quote: Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: To do two things at once is to do neither.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: What you become is far more important than what you get.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does.
author: Dan Millman

quote: It doesn't matter where you are, you are nowhere compared to where you can go.
author: Bob Proctor

quote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
author: Voltaire

quote: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: The more you extend kindness to yourself, the more it will become your automatic response to others.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
author: Socrates

quote: When you've got nothing, you've got nothing to lose.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: Live simply, expect little, give much.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Life is not meant to be easy my child, but take courage: it can be delightful.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: One beam, no matter how big, cannot support an entire house on its own.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don't try.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: There is no value in anything until it is finished.
author: Genghis Khan

quote: Argue for your limitations and sure enough, they're yours.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: Man should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.
author: Rumi

quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Smell the cheese often so you know when it is getting old.
author: Spencer Johnson

quote: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Man's character is his fate.
author: Heraclitus

quote: The merit of all things lies in their difficulty.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: We have to live life with a sense of urgency so not a minute is wasted.
author: Les Brown

quote: If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.
author: Herodotus

quote: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

quote: Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: The first half of life is devoted to forming a healthy ego, the second half is going inward and letting go of it.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing towards being a champion.
author: Billie Jean King

quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: There is nothing more frightful than ignorance in action.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Nothing can dim the light which shines from within.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of a readiness to die.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

quote: It is not enough to win a war; it is more important to organize the peace.
author: Aristotle

quote: Fear of death is fear of surrender to Infinity. Learn to surrender, to exist at Infinity while alive, and fear of death dissolves.
author: Adi Da Samraj

quote: If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Words can only have a positive effect on others if and when they are ready to listen.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
author: Unknown

quote: Stop comparing yourself to others and focus on your own improvement.
author: Lolly Daskal

quote: Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.
author: John Lennon

quote: Trust, like the soul, never returns once it is gone.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: All men are equal before fish.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Judgments prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: The prettiest eyes have cried the most.
author: Unknown

quote: Everything you look at can become a fairy tale and you can get a story from everything you touch.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: I never dwell on what happened. You can't change it. Move forward.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Dreams are the royal road to the unconscious.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say.
author: Martin Luther

quote: If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: A different result requires doing something different.
author: Gary Keller

quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Don't let the silly little dramas of each day get you down. For you are here to do great things.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: He who permits himself to tell a lie once, finds it much easier to do it the second time.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: There are no contests in the Art of Peace. A true warrior is invincible because he or she contests with nothing.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Our life isn't how much we can take out, but how much we can put in.
author: Estee Lauder

quote: If it's not broken, tinker with it till you find out how it works.
author: Bob Proctor

quote: The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.
author: Celestine Chua

quote: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.
author: Confucius

quote: As mortals, we're ruled by conditions, not by ourselves.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: Men learn to love the woman they are attracted to. Women learn to become attracted to the man they fall in love with.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
author: George Eliot

quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

quote: A very little key will open a very heavy door.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: I will not walk backward in life.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: George Eliot

quote: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don't try.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: When the mind is calm, how quickly, how smoothly, how beautifully you will perceive everything.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: It all depends on what you choose to believe.
author: Spencer Johnson

quote: No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Faith means believing the unbelievable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

quote: Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.
author: Unknown

quote: The road to success is always under construction.
author: Steve Harvey

quote: Sorrow is how we learn to love.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Reading should be a pleasure, not a chore.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Never let your memories be greater than your dreams.
author: Doug Ivester

quote: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
author: Unknown

quote: Truth is exact correspondence with reality.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: None but ourselves can free our minds.
author: Bob Marley

quote: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Cherish forever what makes you unique, cuz you're really a yawn if it goes.
author: Bette Midler

quote: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Only when one allows themself the right to die, do they then give yourself the permission to live.
author: C. Sean McGee

quote: Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Others can stop you temporarily - you are the only one who can do it permanently.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Behind every cloud is another cloud.
author: Judy Garland

quote: A man is great not because he hasn't failed; a man is great because failure hasn't stopped him.
author: Confucius

quote: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Truth is the offspring of silence and meditation.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Anything worth doing is worth doing slowly.
author: Mae West

quote: A mountain never yields to the wind no matter how strong it is.
author: Zen Proverb

quote: Whatever happens always happens on time.
author: Zen Proverb

quote: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

quote: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

quote: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

quote: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: It's necessary to get the losers out of your life if you want to live your dream.
author: Les Brown

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
author: Plato

quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The pursuit of mastery bears gifts.
author: Gary Keller

quote: A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does.
author: Dan Millman

quote: Don't let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Trying to predict the future is like trying to drive down a country road at night with no lights while looking out the back window.
author: Peter Drucker
